greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of coefficients, read by rows, where the n-th row forms the polynomial P(n,x) = {Sum_{k=1..n} 1/(k+x)}*{Product_{k=1..n} (k+x)}.
comment: The n-th row polynomial, P(n,x), has ordered zeros {z_k < z_(k+1), 0<k<n} that satisfy z_k + z_(n-k) = -(n+1) and integerpart(z_k) = -k. For even rows, polynomial P(2n,x) has zero z_n = -(n+1)/2. Example: at n=6, P(6,x) has zeros z_1 = -1.336553473264694, z_2 = -2.426299641757407, z_3 = -3.5, z_4 = -4.573700358242594, z_5 = -5.663446526735307.

The higher-order exponential integrals E(x,m,n) are defined in A163931 and the asymptotic expansion of E(x,m=2,n) can be found in A028421. We determined with the latter that E(x,m=2,n+1) = (exp(-x)/x^2)*(1 - (3+2*n)/x + (11+12*n+3*n^2)/x^2 - (50+70*n+30*n^2+ 4*n^3)/x^3 + .... ). The polynomial coefficients in the numerators lead to the coefficients of the triangle given above. The numerators of the o.g.f.s of the right hand columns of this triangle lead for z = 1 to A001147. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Oct 16 2009
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
formula: First column is A000254 (Stirling numbers of first kind s(n, 2): a(n+1)=(n+1)*a(n)+n!), while sum of rows is A001705 (generalized Stirling numbers). Also related to Harmonic numbers: P(n, 0)=n!*H(n), H(n)=harmonic number.
maple: with(combinat): A074246 := proc(n,m): (-1)^(n+m)*binomial(m,1)*stirling1(n+1,m+1) end: seq(seq(A074246(n,m),m=1..n),n=1..9); # _Johannes W. Meijer_, Oct 16 2009, Revised Sep 09 2012
mathematica: p[n_, x_] := Sum[1/(k+x), {k, 1, n}] Product[k+x, {k, 1, n}] ; Flatten[Table[ CoefficientList[ p[n, x] // Simplify[#, ComplexityFunction -> Length] &, x], {n, 1, 9}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 04 2011 *)
xref: See references and formulas at A000254, A001705.  Cf. A028421.
A027480 is the second right hand column. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Oct 16 2009
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Sep 19 2002
